articles.description: Raphael Varane says he has "damaged his body" because of the continued impact of heading the ball.
articles.title: Heading damaged my body and I played on autopilot - Varane

articles.description: The woman who complained about Christian Horner's behaviour is "very upset, angry, scared, intimated and lonely", a family friend tells BBC Sport.
articles.title: Christian Horner complainant is 'upset, scared and lonely', says family friend

articles.description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes asks to not be considered for selection for this summer's T20 World Cup to focus on his fitness.
articles.title: Stokes opts out of T20 World Cup

articles.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board is "starting to pursue" private investment in The Hundred teams, says chief executive Richard Gould.
articles.title: ECB seeking private investment in Hundred teams

articles.description: Ajax chief executive Alex Kroes has been suspended by the Dutch club's supervisory board over allegations of insider trading.
articles.title: Ajax suspend CEO Kroes for alleged insider trading

articles.description: Scotland captain Rachel Corsie says the reaction to the scenes after Arsenal's League Cup final win reflects growing interest in the women's game.
articles.title: 'Cup final clash reaction shows women's game growth'

articles.description: New Zealand's most-capped player Sam Whitelock will retire from rugby at the end of the French club season.
articles.title: New Zealand legend Whitelock to retire

articles.description: Brazilian teams have won the past five editions of the Copa Libertadores. Tim Vickery looks at which sides could stop them this year.
articles.title: Who can end Brazil's Copa Libertadores dominance?

articles.description: Brighton announce record profit and turnover in 2022-23 after the most successful season in the Premier League club's history.
articles.title: Brighton make record £123m profit after fine season

articles.description: England prop Vickii Cornborough retires from international rugby, saying she is "not ready" to balance motherhood and playing for her country.
articles.title: England's Cornborough retires from internationals
